addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my very singular good Lord,
e L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England.

17 May.
1591
. M
r
Bodeleie to my L.
The surprise of
Zutphen
Sconse by
S
r
Francis Vere
./

page.lettertext:
fol.56r
May it please yo
r
good L. by my letter
unto yo
w
e 14 of this moneth, I signified
that S
r
Francis Vere was appointed by the
Councel of state
, before
e intended siege
of Zutphen or
Deventer
should be undertaken,
and before
e troupes of
e contrey should
assemble in those quarters, to endevo
r
the
surprise of
e fort of Zutphen: w
ch
, as we
are informed, at this very present, he hath
perfourmed very happely, so as nowe the
contrey is freed from
e Enemie on this side
the river, and their other designes are made
more easie by muche, to be atchieved by
their forces. What nombers of souldiers
were w
t
in the fort, and what losse is suste-
ned of one side or other, there is nothing
certified in particular. Only this is yet
signified, by a letter sent in hast, that he
tooke it w
t
a strategeme, by
e meanes of
13 souldiers, w
ch
were cladded in boores ap-
parell, and armo
r
underneath, and with
e assistance and company of certaine other
boores, w
ch
were knowen in
e fort for neigh-
bours and contributo
rs
, were presently
suffered to enter a port, w
ch
they kept untill
suche time, as S
r
Francis w
t
his forces possessed
e place. Because this advertisement is
newly come, w
t
a present opportunitie for
sending of my letter, I would not omitte to
impart it w
t
yo
r
L.
and so I take my
humble leave. From
e Hage. May 17
1591. Yo
r
L. most humbly bounde n Tho. Bodley.
